conclusion: Analyze the image to understand the flow paths of the liquid through the baffles.
Identify the connections between the sources (A, B, C, D) and the potential destinations (E, F).
Determine which container the liquid will flow into by following the flow paths.
The image shows four sources labeled A, B, C, and D, each connected to a series of baffles.
The baffles are arranged to direct liquid flow towards two potential containers labeled E and F.
Flow paths are indicated by arrows and colored lines.
Observe the connections from each source (A, B, C, D) to the baffles.
A and B are connected to the same baffle, which directs flow towards E.
C and D are connected to another baffle, which directs flow towards F.
Liquid from A and B will flow into E.
Liquid from C and D will flow into F.
Based on observations, liquid from A and B will flow into E, while liquid from C and D will flow into F.
